isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - REMOTE ACCELERATOR PEDAL SENSOR - SIGNAL FUNCTION

svcproc.title: SIGNAL FUNCTION

note.para: RPS sensor, On/Off switch and circuit supplied by body builder.

svcproc.para: The purpose of the Remote Accelerator Pedal Sensor (RPS) is to allow an operator to adjust engine speed from a remote location. The RPS functions similar to the Accelerator Position Sensor. The RPS sensor is a potentiometer that sends a variable analog voltage signal to the ECM that indicates a desired speed. In order for the RPS to function, the control module must be programmed for remote RPS enable. To activate the RPS the remote variable terminal of the ECM must receive a 12 volt signal.
